httpstwittercomjonkantner httpscodepeniojkantner httpswwwlinkedincominjonkantner10a14992 Publications Converting Color Spaces in JavaScript httpscsstrickscomconvertingcolorspacesinjavascript 201901 An article about creating JavaScript functions to convert a color values color space to another For example RGB to hex hex in rgbarrggbbaa syntax to HSLA and builtin names like red and cornflowerblue to any supported color space Drawing Images with CSS Gradients httpscsstrickscomdrawingimageswithcssgradients 201806 A tutorial on drawing CSS vector images using a singlediv The approach involves using only the lineargradient and radialgradient functions to draw shapes The purpose is to exercise the ability to use the shorthand background syntax especially in the most creative ways possible That Time I Tried Browsing the Web Without CSS httpscsstrickscomthattimeitriedbrowsingthewebwithoutcss 201904 An article about browsing websites with CSS disabled I share my first impressions on five websites and an online tool as well as suggestions for each My experience may have not been great as if I were to disable JavaScript but it made me more awake to how I wrote accessible HTML and CSS Since CSS is a layer of progressive enhancement you can learn how to improve your own site for situations where CSS isnt there
